metadata.Title: CVE-2022-1116 on Ubuntu 18.04 ESM (bionic) - high
metadata.Description:
Integer Overflow or Wraparound vulnerability in io_uring of Linux Kernelallows local attacker to cause memory corruption and escalate privileges toroot. This issue affects: Linux Kernel versions prior to 5.4.189; version5.4.24 and later versions.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-1116` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-5.4.0-152-generic - 5.4.0-113.127~18.04.1
linux-image-5.4.0-152-generic-lpae - 5.4.0-113.127~18.04.1
linux-image-5.4.0-152-lowlatency - 5.4.0-113.127~18.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-5.4.0-152-generic - 5.4.0-113.127~18.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-5.4.0-152-lowlatency - 5.4.0-113.127~18.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.15.0-1143-kvm - 4.15.0-1002.2
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1159-aws - 4.15.0-1001.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-5.4.0-1110-azure - 5.4.0-1080.83~18.04.2
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1005-dell300x - 4.15.0-1005.8
No subscription required

Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: linux-hwe: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'replaced by linux-hwe-5.4').
linux-hwe-5.4 package in esm-infra/bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '5.4.0-113.127~18.04.1').
linux-kvm package in esm-infra/bionic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1002.2').
